intro: Vignea enervis, commonly known as the slender morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, pale to bright yellow flowers that bloom in the morning, giving it its common name. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. Vignea enervis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive blooms and climbing habit.
